intro: Dianthus polycladus var. glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered carnation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Carnation family (Caryophyllaceae). It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its dense clusters of bright red, pink, or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
